hints.content: First, we need to find $47 \dfrac12$ centimeters on the number line.

options.alt: A line plot that has, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 47, 47 and one-half, and 48. The 47 and one-half tick mark is marked with a vertical dotted line. !

hints.content:
Each dot represents one footprint. 

So, we need to count all of the dots on the line plot that represent lengths greater than $47\dfrac12$ centimeters.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A line plot labeled Elephant footprint lengths (centimeters) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 42, 43, 44, 45, 45, 47, 48, 49, and 50. An unlabeled tick mark appears in the middle between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 43, 3 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 44 and 45, 2 dots above 45, 4 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 45 and 46, 5 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 46 and 47, 3 dots above 47, 2 dots above 48, 1 dot above the unlabeled tick mark between 48 and 49, and 2 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 49 and 50. The unlabeled tick mark between 47 and 48 is marked with a vertical dotted line. The dots to the right of the vertical dotted line (to the right of 47 and 1 half centimeters) are all highlighted. !

hints.content:
There are $\purpleD5$ dots that represent lengths greater than $47 \dfrac12$ centimeters.   

$\purpleD5$ footprints are longer than $47 \dfrac12$ centimeters.

question.content:
The lengths of some elephant footprints are shown below.  

[[☃ image 1]]

**How many footprints are longer than $47\dfrac12$ centimeters?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 1]] footprints

options.alt: A line plot labeled Elephant footprint lengths (centimeters) shows, moving left to right, labeled tick marks at 42, 43, 44, 45, 45, 47, 48, 49, and 50. An unlabeled tick mark appears in the middle between each labeled tick mark. Dots are plotted as follows: 1 dot above 43, 3 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 44 and 45, 2 dots above 45, 4 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 45 and 46, 5 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 46 and 47, 3 dots above 47, 2 dots above 48, 1 dot above the unlabeled tick mark between 48 and 49, and 2 dots above the unlabeled tick mark between 49 and 50. !
